review: Holy crap, Chromecast is a trainwreck of a device! It is wholly dependent on you using a laptop, android or ios device. It is basically a device mirroring gadget, what you see on a smartphone, laptop, or tablet screen, is what is mirrored on a larger TV. I was going to give this as a gift but I cannot in good conscience as it is a waste of money for anybody except the most hardcore of tech nerds. This is a cool gadget for a party or family gathering but if you want something to stream your NetFlix, HuLu, Amazon Prime, etc., go buy a Apple TV, Roku, Amazon Fire TV, or modern game console. Those devices have those apps built in and are an always connected to your TV device so all you need is an account to the services you want to watch. If you already have a tablet, just watch your content there. Just remember, if you do not have a smartphone, tablet, or laptop handy when you want to use the device, it is only a powered dongle. At leats with my Apple TV if I want to watch NetFLix or Crunchyroll, I can just turn on the device and link my account and then - BOOM - content is available. If I want to stream my iTunes purchases again - BOOM - it can access my iTunes account and play any purchase I have made. If the apps were built onto the device it would be a worthwhile purchase but since it is wholly dependent on other devices, it is a step down from ANY modern device (game console, streaming box, etc.) in that aspect. The reason that it got at least two stars from me is that the variety of apps you download on your phone that stream natively to the device is impressive.
author: Vernon E. Parker III
